head.title: 'Indians Only' Headline Gives the Wrong Message

hedline.hl1: 'Indians Only' Headline Gives the Wrong Message

abstract.p: Donna Couteau letter comments on Nov 24 Playing in the Neighborhood article noting American Indian harvest ceremony (S)

block.p: As the former artistic director of ''Harvest Ceremony: Beyond the Thanksgiving Myth'' (Playing in the Neighborhood, Nov. 24), I object to the negative messages in your headlines ''Native Festivals, Not the Pilgrims' '' and ''Indians-Only Harvest Festival.''

As the former artistic director of ''Harvest Ceremony: Beyond the Thanksgiving Myth'' (Playing in the Neighborhood, Nov. 24), I object to the negative messages in your headlines ''Native Festivals, Not the Pilgrims' '' and ''Indians-Only Harvest Festival.''

Last year, Joe Cross and I adapted Marty Kreipe de Montano's program titled ''The First Thanksgiving: Diplomacy in New England,'' added the current title, pages of dialogue and emphasized inclusiveness as the central message in our staging.
To print a negative ''Indians only'' message and portray it as a Native American attitude hurts us professionally and, more important, all of us as human beings.
The writer is a member of the Sac and Fox Nation of Oklahoma.
